subject: Skiing
lead_paragraph: Ted Ligety won the bronze medal in a giant slalom at the world championships in Val d’Isère, France, the first medal by the American men this week. Carlo Janka of Switzerland won gold with a two-run time of 2 minutes 18.82 seconds down the Face de Bellevarde course. Benjamin Raich of Austria finished second, 0.71 behind, and Ligety was third, 0.99 back. The American Bode Miller crashed out in the second run for the second straight race.
